summary: The Second Chechen War, also called the Second Chechen Campaign by Russians, was a conflict that happened after the First Chechen War. It started in 1999 when Russia sent troops back into Chechnya, a region fighting for independence. From the Chechen fighters' perspective, it was seen as a resistance against the second Russian invasion. The war was brutal, with many casualties, and it ended in 2009 with Russia maintaining control over Chechnya.
title: Second Chechen War
